channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Donald Trump gives TikTok 45 days to complete potential sale to Microsoft
item.description: Trump on Thursday night signed the order titled 'Addressing the Threat Posed by TikTok', which bars any transaction with TikTok parent ByteDance after 45 days from the signing.

item.title: Jennifer Garner and Bradley Cooper enjoy Malibu beach date
item.description: They had sizzling on-screen chemistry when they starred alongside each other in her hit TV show Alias between 2001 to 2006.

item.title: Prince Harry says social media stoking 'crisis of hate'
item.description: Prince Harry on Thursday said social media was stoking a 'crisis of hate,' and he appealed to companies to rethink their roles in advertising on digital platforms.

item.title: Gilead says it has ramped up production of remdesivir by 50-fold
item.description: On Thursday, Gilead Sciences Inc says it expects to meet 'real-time global demand' for remdesivir by October and will produce two million treatment courses by the end of 2020.

item.title: Joe Biden APOLOGIZES for suggesting Latino American community is more diverse than African Americans
item.description: President Donald Trump said before departing the White House Thursday that Joe Biden 'totally disparaged and insulted the black community'. Biden tweeted an apology Thursday evening.

item.title: D-Day hero who captured the German army's tallest soldier in World War Two has died aged 97Â
item.description: Corporal Bob Roberts, who stood at 5ft 3in, took the surrender of 7ft 6in Jakob Nacken in September 1944.

item.title: Pictured: 'Troubled' neighbour who 'shot children's book-writing parish councillor'
item.description: James Nash, 42, was in hospital last night with serious injuries following the attack in the pretty Hampshire hamlet of Upper Enham, near Andover.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Politician blames Hezbollah and government
item.description: Lebanese security forces faced off with dozens of protestors last night, furious at the devastating explosion which is seen as a prime example of the government's incompetence.

item.title: Beirust explosion: Politician blames Hezbollah and government
item.description: Bahaa Hariri, 54, said last night that everyone in the city knew Hezbollah controlled Beirut's port and airport and it was inconceivable authorities did not know the deadly ammonium nitrate.

item.title: Fears for holidays as travel experts warn France 'is highly likely' to be added to quarantine list
item.description: Travellers from France could soon face a 14 days of self-isolation on their return to the UK following a dramatic rise in coronavirus cases, according to travel experts.

item.title: TOM LEONARD: No wonder A-listers can't resist the city where stars hit the jackpot every day
item.description: TOM LEONARD: Playing the same hits every night, month after month - or even year after year - is the opposite of the artistic credibility to which Paul McCartney still lays claim.

item.title: Ellen DeGeneres bullied 11-year-old boy by calling him 'fat' and 'stupid'
item.description: Ben Gravolet, 52, told DailyMailTV that 'vile' Ellen DeGeneres bullied him as an 11-year-old boy, calling him 'fat' and 'stupid' when the TV host worked for his mother in the 1970s in New Orleans.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein victim recalls being abused as a 19-year-old virgin
item.description: A former model and one of the alleged victims of Jeffery Epstein has recalled how she was assaulted by him in 2004 when she was just 19 years old, struggling for rent in New York City.

item.title: Addison Rae is revealed as TikTok's highest earner after making $5M
item.description: Addison, 19, has topped the Forbes list of TikTok's seven highest-earning stars after making $5 million in one year.

item.title: Ontario grandmother, 50, praised after body transformation
item.description: Charlene Farnsworth, from Grassie, Ontario, had always been slim, but when she turned 40, she began indulging in unhealthy foods and piled on the pounds.

item.title: Dean Gaffney's EastEnders co-star slams him for 'partying in Ibiza while thousands die each day'
item.description: The soap star, 42, flaunted her sunsoaked Spanish getaway on Instagram at the end of July, leaving fellow EastEnders actor JamieÂ Borthwick to put his partying in context

item.title: Britain braces for hottest day EVER as baking Saharan air threatens to send temperatures past 102F
item.description: Temperatures of at least 37C (99F) are forecast in London and the South East today, with a chance that last Friday's 37.8C (100F) recorded at Heathrow Airport could be broken.

item.title: The divorce that split America: It's the subject of a gripping new Netflix drama
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: A shopping expedition in the Californian city of San Diego on Saturday November 4 would mark the last normal day of Betty Broderick's life.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: The daft idea that became an interstellar smash
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: As the recent feature-length Red Dwarf special proved, it's funnier than ever. That's the real significance of this three-part documentary celebration of the series.

item.title: More than 100 children in care were imprisoned under 'deprivation of liberty' orders, survey finds
item.description: The Freedom of Information requests to 91 councils in England and Wales showed the number of 'deprivation of liberty' orders increased from 43 in 2016-17 to 134 in 2018-19.

item.title: Government plans to end automatic one-third reduction for guilty pleas
item.description: Justice Secretary Robert Buckland is reportedly studying proposals to end the current practice of reducing jail sentences by one third.

item.title: Young women are most likely to suffer depression, anxiety and loneliness in lockdown, study shows
item.description: University College London' found poor mental health in lockdown was most common in 19 year olds. But 30-year-old women have had the biggest increase in ill mental health during lockdown.

item.title: Mother of tragic Charlie Gard feels 'surge of pure love' as she holds her newborn son
item.description: ThisÂ was the moment of pure joy the mother of tragic Charlie Gard could scarcely believe. She locked eyes on Charlie's 'miracle' baby brother as he was handed to her wrapped in a towel.

item.title: Father-of-30 miner says he has made his THIRD multi-million-pound find in weeksÂ
item.description: Saniniu Laizer found Tanzanite, which has a deep violet-blue colour, near his home in northern Tanzania.

item.title: 'Radicalised' man who took six people hostage in French bank is arrested after turning himself inÂ
item.description: The man emerged slowly from the BRED bank wearing a balaclava and with his hands turned palms-up, before officers with their weapons raised moved in and handcuffed him.

item.title: Payday loan firms lure borrowers into debt with pictures of exotic holidays, City watchdog warns
item.description: The high-cost credit industry was accused of 'normalising' the use of loans that charge interest rates of more than 1,000 per cent - compared with a typical credit card rate of 20 per cent.

item.title: Knifeman who killed Arsenal fan at Tube station faces life in jail
item.description: Tashan Daniel, a talented 200 metre sprinter, was on his way to see Arsenal play Nottingham Forest when he was stabbed in the chest by Alex Lanning, 23, at Hillingdon tube station.

item.title: Argos releases its top Christmas toy predictions
item.description: Time spent at home during lockdown has generated a strong sense of nostalgia for our favourite toys which is likely to influence parents' buying habits, according to Argos' research.

item.title: Hospitals warned they must not axe non-covid treatments despite a possible second wave
item.description: Doctors have warned that cancelling non-urgent operations will affect tens of thousands of patients. The lockdown has been linked to thousands of avoidable deaths among non-coronavirus patients.

item.title: Kate Middleton's fashion favourite Jigsaw becomes the latest high street victim of coronavirusÂ
item.description: Jigsaw, owned by Carphone Warehouse tycoon David Ross, has been a fixture in the wardrobes of middle-class British women for 50 years.

item.title: Three migrants rescued from sinking kayak by builder swimming from Dover to Calais for charity
item.description: Three migrants were spotted by builderÂ Justin Legge, 49, from Bridge near Canterbury, Kent, in a sinking inflatable kayak worth Â£299.99 10 miles away from Dover at around 3.30pm.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Bahamas, Belgium, Andorra quarantine to end
item.description: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps has said people arriving in Britain from Belgium, Andorra and the Bahamas will have to quarantine from 4am on Saturday.

item.title: 'Furious' Priti Patel backs sending the Royal Navy to tackle the migrant crisis
item.description: Officials have been ordered to draw up plans in which, for the first time, the Navy could turn back boats. Up to 250 migrants crossed the channel on Thursday, the highest total since the crisis began.

item.title: Number of police firearms operations drop for the first time in four years
item.description: Operations fell four per cent to just under 19,400 in England and Wales in the year to March, a Home Office report shows.

item.title: Daisy Edgar-Jones is one of UK's most influential women
item.description: Daisy Edgar-Jones, pictured, has been announced by Vogue as one of the 25 most influential woman in Britain, along with Queen Elizabeth II and Emily Maitlis.

item.title: Saudi Crown Prince 'sent hit men to Canada to assassinate top "spy" and arrested his children'
item.description: Saad Aljabri (left) has filed suit against Mohammed bin Salman (bottom right) alleging that the Saudi ruler ordered his assassination and seized his two children, including daughter Sarah (top right).

item.title: Alarm over radical planning reforms that will place building burden on rich areasÂ
item.description: Affluent areas will be forced to build more new homes in a radical shake-up of the planning system that will see computers decide on applications.

item.title: Facebook will allow employees to work remotely until July 2021
item.description: The social media giant announced the news to Business Insider on Thursday, also revealing that they would also be giving workers money to pay for home office supplies.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Two-thirds think there'll be a second lockdown
item.description: A nationwide survey commissioned by blood testing company Medichecks found one in five people in July believed they had already had Covid-19 despite not having tested positive.

item.title: Couple reports Durham police to watchdog over Dominic Cummings' lockdown breach
item.description: Clare Edwards and her husband Dave have reported Durham Constabulary to the police watchdog over allegations Dominic Cummings breached lockdown a second time.

item.title: NHS accused of wasting 'eye-watering' amount of money
item.description: Private firm Serco has a Â£108million 13-week deal to get in touch with people who test positive and their close contacts and encourage them to isolate for two weeks.

item.title: TOM UTLEY: How a newborn and a 98th birthday in the family has set me thinking of the future
item.description: TOM UTLEY: The conjunction of these two events has set me thinking as never before about the passage of time and how close every one of us is to history.

item.title: Millions of drivers were overcharged fuel by up to Â£10-a-tank in lockdownÂ
item.description: Although supermarket pump prices sank to a four-year low of 99p a litre in May, fuel giants still made a fortune.

item.title: ULRIKA JONSSON says it's only the British who are so hung up on baring all in a heatwave
item.description: ULRIKA JONSSON: I posted it to my Instagram, then got back to dozing in the sunshine. I didn't think anything of it. I have no problem being naked.

item.title: Twitter adds labels to state-backed media and editors as well as government accounts
item.description: Twitter on Thursday announced the new steps to prevent the spread of content from state-affiliated media -- a move affecting key outlets from Russia and China.

item.title: Harry Styles has added Â£50m to his fortune ON TOP of his One Direction earnings since going solo
item.description: Harry Styles has reportedly addedÂ Â£50 million to his fortune since quitting One Direction and becoming a solo artist.

item.title: Coronavirus: Vaccine may be less effective in obese adults
item.description: Health experts say obese adults have chronic mild inflammation, which may lead to an impaired T-cell response to a vaccine, and that could leave one of the most at-risk populations vulnerable.

item.title: Award-winning Daily Mail photographer who snapped SAS storming the Iranian Embassy dies aged 66
item.description: Dave Parker has died at the age of 66. The photographer came to fame when he won the British Press Photographer of the Year for his snaps of the SAS storming the Iranian embassy in 1980.

item.title: Chemists call for powers to change customers' prescriptions if items are out of stock
item.description: Pharmacists called the current process 'a waste of everybody's time' and said the powers would speed up access to medicines, give them more face-to-face time with patients and cut GPs' workload.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Dishi Rishi's summer special - money for nothing and your chips for free
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Remember those terrible old hospital jokes which began: Do you want the good news or the bad news? 'Give me the bad news first, doctor.' 'You've got Aids.'

item.title: A quarter of puppies are taken from their mothers too young
item.description: Taking puppies from their mothers too soon has been linked with behavioural problems including barking excessively and destroying things.

item.title: England's schools get powers to appeal GCSE/A-level results
item.description: England's exams regulator has said schools and colleges can appeal if they can prove that historical data used to standardise grades is not a reliable indicator of this year's results.

item.title: Coronavirus US: 300k deaths predicted before the end of 2020
item.description: The University of Washington's Institute for Health Metrics revised its death toll forecast on Thursday to predict nearly 300,000 deaths by December 1.

item.title: Pentagon says there is 'no definitive cause' for the Beirut blast
item.description: Pentagon spokesman Jonathan Hoffman said that no definitive cause for the deadly explosion that ripped through Beirut has been identified so far, after Donald Trump claimed it was an attack.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Footage shows how blaze sparked blast
item.description: Imad Khalil and Lena Allama were recording the Port of Beirut fire on their balcony when they were sent flying backwards into their apartment by the huge devastating explosion.

item.title: Duchess of York's sons-in-law quit Fergie's fledgling firm
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: She has welcomed her sons-in-law, declaring 'never has a mother been more proud' than when Edo Mapelli Mozzi married Princess Beatrice last month.

item.title: Woman shares terrifying postpartum psychosis experience
item.description: Catherine Cho, 31, and James Choi, 37, has son Cato in 2017. Three months later, she hallucinated her son's eyes turn to devil's eyes, and heard God tell her that her son had to die.

item.title: Dominic Cummings'Â 260mile trip to County Durham eroded public trust, study shows
item.description: Research published in the prestigious journal the Lancet shows the scandal, which emerged on May 22, led to a sharp drop in public trust in the UK Government's handling of the pandemic.

item.title: Mother, 20, was killed by a blood clot three weeks after giving birth to her second child
item.description: Jasmine Donkin, 20, was not considered at risk of clots and not given blood-thinning drugs. Three weeks after the birth of her second child, Callie-Grace, she collapsed at home in Herne Bay, Kent.

item.title: Two thirds of NHS staff 'lost their sense of taste or smell during coronavirus peak'
item.description: Almost two-thirds of staff at London's Barts Health NHS Trust said they had suffered anosmia - a loss of taste or smell - in a questionnaire they completed in April.

item.title: 'Couch potato' shed 15 kilograms in just seven months - and transformed her entire figure
item.description: A mum-of-two and 'couch potato' who used to skip breakfast every day has revealed how she lost 15 kilos in seven months. Julie Durbhakula, from New South Wales, revealed exactly how.

item.title: Caroline Flack and Lewis Burton 'assault' accounts conflicted
item.description: Police attended Flack's home in December after Mr Burton, said to be bleeding profusely from a cut to his head, phoned emergency services saying she was trying to kill him.

item.title: Worst recession in 100 years - but not in 300 years as first feared, Bank of England predicts
item.description: The Bank of England said it expected the downturn and jobs crisis triggered by the Covid-19 pandemic will not be as bad as it previously feared.

item.title: Jeff Bezos sells $3.1BILLION in Amazon stock to help fun fund his new private aerospace company
item.description: Jeff Bezos, the world's richest man, had said he planned to sell stock worth about $1 billion each year to fund his rocket company, Blue Origin.

item.title: NRA counter-sues NY Attorney General for trying to dismantle their organization
item.description: New York's famously anti-Trump Attorney General Letitia James announced on Thursday that she is suing the NRA, claiming its leadership used the organization as a 'personal piggy bank'.

item.title: Raphael reconstruction helps solves mystery of artist's skeleton
item.description: The artist, a child prodigy and part of a trinity of Renaissance greats along with Michelangelo and Leonardo da Vinci, died in 1520, aged only 37.

item.title: A man for all (football) seasons: What it's like to be a man of a certain age by David Kynaston
item.description: David Kynaston, one of the most prolific and admired historians of the modern age, recalls the 2016-17 season, as Aldershot Town F.C. were pushing for promotion back into the Football League.

item.title: JAN MOIR: I fear Caroline Flack's whole life had become a trialÂ
item.description: JAN MOIR The inquest into the death of Caroline Flack took place this week, with the coroner ruling that the television star took her own life by suicide.

item.title: MANDY APPLEYARD: 'How my mother's cruel stroke changed me for the better'
item.description: MANDY APPLEYARD: Since November last year, I have been working as my 83-year-old mother's day and night-time carer, after she suffered a catastrophic stroke six months earlier.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Last photo emerges of firefighters before blast
item.description: A tragic last photo has emerged showing firefighters prying open a door at Beirut's Warehouse 12 just moments before it exploded with the force of a small nuke.

item.title: Why we shouldn't always follow the science
item.description: Stuart Ritchie who is a lecturer at the Institute of Psychiatry, Psychology and Neuroscience at King's College, London, explores the flaws surrounding scientific research in a new book.

item.title: Do goblins tickle feet in Siberia?
item.description: Jonathan C. Slaght has penned a book about his quest to track down and protect the biggest owls on earth. Blakiston's fish owl are mostly found in the remote East Russian province of Primorye.

item.title: Enid Lindeman was rich, unfaithful and outlived four husbands. No wonder they called her Killmore
item.description: Robert Wainwright explores the high-society life of formidable Enid Lindeman whose four husbands - a commoner, general, viscount and an earl - died young while she was still married to them.

item.title: Micro-preemie baby survives after being born at 22 weeks
item.description: Lura Lauer, 28, and her fiancÃ© Ricky Garcia, 39, from Charlotte, North Carolina, welcomed twins Lyric Elaine and Cali Rose on July 15, four months before her November 16 due date.

item.title: RUTH SUNDERLAND: Shadow of the jobs axeÂ
item.description: Maybe it will come as a huge relief to learn that the Bank of England is no longer forecasting the worst downturn in 300 years and only the biggest for a century but then again maybe not.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 950 new cases and 49 deaths in official toll
item.description: Department of Health statistics show 835 Britons are now getting diagnosed each day - with the rolling seven-day average having consistently risen since it dropped to a four-month low on July 8 (546).

item.title: Violent thug, 43, admits attempting to murder mother, 36, by stabbing her SEVEN times
item.description: Mark Brazant, 44, has admitted trying to kill young mother Josephine Conlon (pictured), who he repeatedly stabbed in Streatham last December, days after being released from prison.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Emmanuel Macron promises conditional aid
item.description: Speaking at a news conference, theÂ French President called for an international inquiry into the devastating explosion as he promised aid to blast-stricken Lebanon.

item.title: DNA from Denisovans can be found in humans today
item.description: Researchers from the US have determined that around three per cent of the Neanderthal genome came from breeding with another ancient human group.

item.title: Coronavirus Northern Ireland: R-rate could be as high as 1.8
item.description: Northern Ireland's department of health said the country's R rate could be as high as 1.8 after more than 20 clusters were identified in the region.

item.title: BBC gets over 18k complaints after N-word used in broadcast
item.description: BBC journalist Fiona Lamdin, left, used a racially offensive slur during a news broadcast on July 29 when interviewing the victim of a racist hit and run attack in Bristol.

item.title: Janet Street-Porter says pubs must shut if people can't behave
item.description: JANET STREET-PORTER: Last week's lockdown in Manchester brought absolutely no difference to the numbers swanning about on Friday night, hoping to get hammered.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Russian who owned explosives is questioned
item.description: Russian businessman Igor Grechushkin was asked a 'list of questions' by Cypriot investigators in Limassol this afternoon on behalf of the Lebanese authorities.

item.title: Eat, Shop, Save: Family saves Â£550 and lose stone in 8 weeks
item.description: Sergio and Fatima Paiva live with their daughters Helena, 16, and Victoria, four, in Southport, and appear on ITV's Eat, Shop, Save tonight, completing a challenge to become healthier and save money.

item.title: Disgraced BHS entrepreneur, 52, is dumped by his 37-year-old wifeÂ
item.description: Dominic Chappell, 52, is living in a hotel after his 37-year-old wife, Rebecca Chappell, threw him out of their Tudor manor house in Dorset. Mrs Chappell is understood to be filing for divorce.

item.title: Britain gets its first Dutch-style roundabout that gives priority to cyclists
item.description: Cyclists have an outer ring on the Cambridge roundabout, with cycle crossings over each of the four approach roads in a contrasting red surface.

item.title: Bill de Blasio slams rich 'fairweather friends' who fled New York
item.description: Mayor de Blasio blasted wealthy New Yorkers Thursday saying that 'as everyone else is suffering the rich are getting richer' while he raked in $9,000-a-month from rentals amid the pandemic.

item.title: Human hair chips away at a razor's edge, engineers say
item.description: In shaving experiments, engineers closely studied shaving in ultra-fine detail with an electron microscope to see how a razor blade can be damaged as it cuts human hair.

item.title: Fears over UK ammonium nitrate storage after Beirut explosion
item.description: Explosives and safety experts say a Beirut-style mega-blast could not happen in the UK - because of strict production and storage rules on the substance linked to the tragedy

item.title: Arabians used same toolmaking techniques as Native Americans
item.description: Dozens of examples of 'fluting' have been found in Yemen and Oman which date back 8,000 years. This technique had never been seen before outside of America.

item.title: Bombproof luxury penthouse in MI6 HQ goes on sale for Â£5.5m
item.description: The stunning penthouse located over the top three floors of the prominent Whitehall Court in central London was once the home of Sir Mansfield Smith-Cumming.

item.title: Noel Gallagher spent Â£1,000 so woman could hit sales targets
item.description: Audrey Indome, from London, revealed on Twitter that Noel Gallagher once bought 10 pairs of black Levi's 501s so she could reach her sales target while working at Selfridges.

item.title: Menopausal women may be denied entry to airports using temperature scanners for Covid-19
item.description: Rapid temperature detection devices measure heat in the skin, which can become warm during a 'hot flush'. British doctors said menopausal women may be mistaken for having a fever.

item.title: Prince Harry's royal biographerÂ Angela Levin says he has become 'a shadow of his former self'
item.description: Angela Levin, who wrote Harry: Conversations with the Prince in 2018, appeared on ITV's Royal Rota and revealed that the Duke of Sussex, 35, had 'changed enormously' since their first meeting.

item.title: Eating too much rice increases your risk of dying from heart disease
item.description: Researchers at the universities of Manchester and Salford studied rice consumption in England and Wales and prevalence ofÂ cardiovascular diseases caused by arsenic exposure.

item.title: Cleaner, 47, appears in court over Tamara Ecclestone theft
item.description: A cleaner caught with Â£300,000 earrings stolen after a raid on Tamara Ecclestone's home says she has no idea who two of her co-defendants are. Maria Mester, 47, denies charges

item.title: Explorer exposes the dramatic impact of global warming in stark pictures
item.description: Chilean explorer and photographer Cristian Donoso has dedicated the last 24 years of his life to exposing the impact of climate change in more than 50 expeditions.
item.media:credit: Alberto de Agostini / Museo Salesiano Maggiorino Borgatello

item.title: UK parents copy celebrity trend to 'have children of both sexes'
item.description: Researchers found much more families than expected kept having children until they have at least one boy and one girl, just like the Beckhams and the Kardashian family.

item.title: Want a last-minute staycation? Try a youth hostel in the Peak District, known as the English Alps
item.description: After foreign holidays hit the wall and UK B&Bs sold out, Jake Wallis Simons plumped for a family youth hostel break in the Peak District - and had no regrets whatsoever.

item.title: Britain's most popular rural retreats are revealed
item.description: Rightmove said it is seeing an uplift in UK city dwellers considering moving to the countryside - and this is outperforming an increase it is also seeing in home hunters looking to move from a city to a town.

item.title: Coronavirus: Could gum disease make infection more deadly?
item.description: Researchers in California and Brazil say that COVID-19 patients with high levels of interleukin-6 (IL-6), that suggests someone has. gum disease were far more likely to need ventilators to stay alive.
item.media:credit: Journal of the California Dental Association

item.title: Lorry driver who killed two in M58 crash was using phone apps
item.description: James Majury, 33, opened a number of apps as well as sending text messages to his mother moments before he ploughed his HGV into the back of a school minibus on the M58 in Lancashire

item.title: Germany demands UK is more 'realistic and pragmatic' in Brexit trade talks
item.description: Berlin's Europe minister Michael Roth said he was 'disappointed' with the UK's tough stance amid rising fears that the negotiations could fail.

item.title: Prince Charles to extend Balmoral holiday as 'fishing is so good'
item.description: Prince Charles, 71, and the Duchess of Cornwall, 73, kicked off their break at their Scottish residence ofÂ Birkhall this week after he paid a visit toÂ Caithness General Hospital in Wick on Friday, Hello! reported.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Firefighters who died as blast hit warehouse
item.description: Jo Noon, Methal Hawwa and Najib Hitti were part of a 10-person rapid response team that is all missing, with one female colleague,Â Sahar Faris, who was due to be married, confirmed dead.

item.title: Supercar swerves across traffic and speeds down slip road seconds before police car appears
item.description: Dashcam footage captured on August 1 shows the moment an orange car speeds across two lanes of cars to take an exit. The incident happened on the A3 heading towards Portsmouth in Hampshire.

item.title: Dad threw daughter, 4, over fence to save her after 12 foot, 600-pound alligator swam toward her
item.description: Andrew Grande threw his daughter over a fence as a 12ft long alligator swam toward her in a creek adjacent to their home in League City, Texas. Animal control removed the gator.

item.title: Prison officer, 26, had sexual relationship with inmate serving life
item.description: Kerianne Stephens, 26, of Aylesford, Kent, was employed at HMP Swaleside on the Isle of Sheppey when she had the affair with 34-year-old Louis Tate.

item.title: Chinese city builds a motorway bridge around a house after its stubborn owner refused to move
item.description: Footage shows the one-storey property tightly wedged between two wings of the newly opened Haizhuyong Bridge in the metropolis of Guangzhou in Guangdong province.

item.title: How the Duchess of Cambridge nailed mask makeup with a bold brow, soft powder and smokey eye
item.description: Makeup artist Lisa Little told FEMAIL the Duchess of Cambridge, 38, has been 'rocking' the mask makeup look as she donned face coverings for royal visits for the first time this week.

item.title: Princess Anne's 70th birthday party at the palace has been cancelled
item.description: The Princess Royal, who turns 70 next week, had been due to celebrate with a soiree hosted by her mother the Queen, 94, at Buckingham Palace, a source told Vanity Fair.

item.title: Earbud-like device claims to boost linguistic skills by zapping your ear
item.description: The simple gadget dramatically improves the wearer's ability to learn new words, say the University of Pittsburgh team behind the research new development.

item.title: Madeleine McCann suspect unlikely to walk free
item.description: Investigators in the Madeleine McCann case breathed a sigh of relief today after the EU's top court moved to block suspect Christian Bruekner's dramatic court bid for release.

item.title: Amazon is accused of 'opting out' of paying fair taxes
item.description: Amazon has announced plans to increase its referral fees, fulfilment by Amazon fees, monthly FBA Storage fees and multichannel fulfilment fees by two per cent for its UK customers.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... back to school
item.description: 'Back to school in September? I thought I was in a 'lethargy bubble' with dad'

item.title: Mother of Charlie Gard is 'nervous but excited' for the imminent birth of her second child
item.description: Charlie's tragic fight gripped the world after he was born with a rare condition. He died after his parents lost an extraordinary court battle against the medical system to keep him alive.

item.title: Charlie Gard's parents tell of their joy as they release 20-week scan of healthy unborn child
item.description: Six months pregnant Connie Yates yesterday told of her delight - and showed the Mail the uncanny likeness of the unborn child to Charlie.

item.title: Charlie Gard's parents crying with joy as they are expecting another child
item.description: Connie Yates and Chris Gard are expecting their second child almost four years to the day that their first baby Charlie was born. The tragic child battled for 11 months with a genetic disorder.

item.title: Tafida Raqeeb survives OFF life-support: 'Big step' for British five-year-old
item.description: Tafida Raqeeb (pictured) - the brain-damaged five-year-old written off by NHS doctors - was yesterday deemed well enough to move out of intensive care in hospital in Italy.
